comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

When visiting the same webpage with the earlier firefox version (v3.XX) the web page was correctly viewed. This version now cuts part of the menu in the left side.
However if viewing the page with Chrome and the earlier version of firefox everything is normal.
With firefox latest version the menu partially disappears...
This might be just a minor thing but it's annoying if it propagates to other sites...

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Just load the page on firefox
2.Always cuts part of the menu
3.



Firefox 4.0 shouldn't cut the menu like earlier firefox versions and like Chrome and Opera...
comments.author: plmrito@gmail.com

comments.text:
This site uses rigid CSS formatting with fixed-size <div> elements, which
assume certain font metrics. 

I can see similar clipping issues when page zoom-in on Firefox3.6.16.

Maybe dupelication of Bug 628601.
comments.raw_text:

assume certain font metrics. 

I can see similar clipping issues when page zoom-in on Firefox3.6.16.

Not sure if it's a dupe of bug 628601 but it seems to be caused by the same usage of fixed-size <div>
